greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers n such that n concatenated with n-9 gives the product of two numbers which differ by 6.
comment: Contained in, and apparently identical, to A116129.
Numbers n such that n*(10^d+1) is a square, where n-9 has d decimal digits.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..134
maple: if a^2 < c then a:= a+1 fi;
if b^2 > c then b:= b-1 fi;
results.author: _Giovanni Resta_, Feb 06 2006
